intro: Machaerium firmum, commonly known as the rigid machaerium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Leguminosae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Machaerium firmum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Its ecological role includes nitrogen fixation, which enriches the soil and supports other plant life.
